result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Mendoza Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 15CF956

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Ricardo Mendoza in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Ricardo Mendoza in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. on 15CF956 & 15CF961.

State indicates compliance with Chapter 950 and no additions or corrections to PSI.
Defense indicated no additions or corrections to PSI.

State recommends on 956 2-3 years IC & 3 years ES; on 961 3 years IC & 3 years ES, stand silent as to whether consecutive or concurrent.  
Defense joins in recommendation.

BTC:  on 956 count 2:  WPS 4 years (2 IC & 2 ES)
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment
comply with any child support or family court orders
no contact, directly or indirectly, with Kohl's
Restitution of $225 to Kohl's Department Store

on 961:  WPS 3 years ( 1 year IC & 2 years ES)
same conditions, consecutive to 956 count 2
CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample
firearms/voting warnings
Costs including DNA on both counts
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting
